snippet: An organized crime ring conspired to steal more than $250 million, federal authorities said.
abstract: Federal authorities say an crime ring in Brighton Beach, Brooklyn, conspired to steal more than $250 million from health insurance companies; details cast unflattering spotlight on how Russian-speaking immigrants have often dominated such schemes in New York City; plot involved 10 doctors, 9 separate clinics and 105 different corporations.

byline.contributor: Colin Moynihan and Tim Stelloh contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: An organized crime ring conspired to steal more than $250 million, federal authorities said.

headline.seo: Dozens Said to Be Arrested in Health Care Fraud Scheme
headline.main: A $250 Million Fraud Scheme Finds a Path to Brighton Beach
headline.print_headline: A $250 Million Fraud Scheme Finds a Path to Brighton Beach
